Lilian is married and has four children. She manages a business buying and selling crabs. For five years in her business, Lilian has earned enough so that she has been able to provide for her family's daily needs. 

Lilian successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to buy crabs. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional crabs and prawn to sell. Lilian is determined to save a portion of her profit for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs and prawn to sell.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en: Lelia is married and has four children. She has owned and operated a retail business for nine years earning a good living. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used her previous loan in her business and it helped a lot in running the business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy more products for his general store which has been running for four years now. His income from the business is helping support everyday expenses at home. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their family since their children will soon go to school.
 
He would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, and he will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Profits from his business will definitely help him sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Darwin hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to give a good future to his children. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos lives in Kilifi county, where he runs his business. He deals in second-hand clothes sales. He is 21 years old and single. He started the business out of his own savings, and the business has been growing. 

He knew Milango through friends and now, he seeks a loan to buy bales of clothes for sale. The challenge that he faces in the business is competition. He hopes that in the next five years, he will be running a big shop in town that will be selling clothes. Income that comes out of the business will help him go back to school and finish his college education.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Ana Zhien

texts.en:
Ana Zhien is 33 years old and married.

Ana Zhien works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Ana Zhien has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Ana Zhien aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.ru:
Руслана работает учительницей игры на фортепиано в  школе  искусства. Она хорошо воспитана и образована. Руслана серьезно относится ко всем расходам, ведет четкий расчет доходов и расходов. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Руслана поменяла двери (это видно на фото) и отремонтировала полы в доме. Однако закончить ремонт не удалось и нужны дополнительные средства.  

В этот раз Руслана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20 000 на ремонт ванной комнаты в их доме.  Ванна была построена еще во времена советского союза и сейчас выглядит ужасно. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en:
Ruslana is a teacher of acting and piano at an art school.  She is well-bred and educated.  Ruslana is serious about minding her expenses and she keeps to a strict budget.  Thanks to her earlier loan, Ruslana replaced her door (as you can see in the photo) and repaired her floors.  However, she was not able to finish all the repairs and she needs additional funds.  

This time, Ruslana is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to fix the bathroom.  The bathroom was installed way back in Soviet times and now it looks just awful.  The loan will help her to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia is married and lives in Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay in Zamboanga del Sur. Eufemia manufactures and sells bamboo products such as "banig" and "dingding" (floor and wall mats) to local businesses and community members. Using her previous loan from GDMPC to purchase equipment and tools, the business did well so she was able to repay her loan successfully. Aside from selling bamboo products, she also sells snacks in the market on weekends to earn additional income. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором жительница района Шахритус. Она замужем за Бахтиёра. У них двое совместных детей. Дочери 19 лет, а младшему сыну 15 лет. Дилором нигде не работает, она домохозяйка. Дилором сидела дома и присматривала за детьми. Теперь, когда ее дети повзрослели, она может работать. Дилором решила начать свой бизнес по продаже кондитерских изделий. Дилором насчитанная и ответственная женщина. Она нашла и арендовала место для продажи и нашла оптовых продавцов. Она будет привозить товар из города Душанбе, и продавать его на Родном районе Шахритус. В ее работе будет помогать ее дочь. Но для приобретения и привозки товара у Дилором нет достаточной суммы денег, по этой причине она просит кредит. Дилором надеется, что Вы ей поможете, и она начнет свой бизнес.
texts.en: Dilorom is a resident of the Shahritus region. Her husband's name is Bakhtiyor and they have two children: a 19-year-old daughter and a 15-year-old son. Dilorom is a homemaker and instead of working, has always stayed at home looking after the children. Now that they have grown up, she is able to work, and has decided to start a business selling confectionery goods. Dilorom is a responsible woman who can be counted on and she has found and rented a place for her shop as well as a wholesale seller. She will bring in goods from the city of Dushanbe and sell them in her home region of Shahritus, and her daughter will help her with the business. Dilorom doesn't have enough capital to begin stocking inventory, and for this reason she is requesting a loan. She hopes that you will help her so she can start her business.

loans.use: to purchase confectionery goods

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is 42 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling clothes for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sada is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her transport her clothes to sell in the village faster and much easier. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a store to run a clothes shop in the market and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make more it comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса ведет свое хозяйство вместе с сыном и мамой. Они живут в селе и при доме у них есть большой участок земли. За 10 лет  построили три большие теплицы, еще есть две теплицы под рассаду. В прошлом году провели отопление. Лариса говорит, что с отопление гораздо лучше: "Трудимся также, но доход гораздо больше!" Ей трудно было растить одной сына, средств не хватало, но сейчас она радостная, появилась уверенность и успех, также сын подрос и теперь есть на кого опереться.

Ларисе очень помогают кредиты. Когда брала в первый раз боялась, но со временем поняла, что не смогла бы без них достичь сегодняшних результатов. Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит 25,000 гривен. Она хочет построить  дополнительную теплицу, это поможет ей посадить больше помидор. Еще на участке есть свободная земля, где можно построить  две теплицы,поэтому Лариса  надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Larisa runs her farm with the help of her son and her mother.  They live in a village and have a large plot of land.  Over the last 10 years, they built three large greenhouses, and they have two others for seedlings.  Last year they installed a heating system.  Larisa reports that this was a big improvement.  She says, "we work as hard as before, but our income is much bigger!"  It was difficult for her to raise her son alone.  They never had enough money, but now she is joyful because they now have some security and success, and with her son now grown, she has someone on whom she can rely.

The loans really help Larisa.  She was fearful when she took out the first one, but with time she has come to understand that without the loan she wouldn't have been able to get to where she is today.  Larisa is requesting a loan of 25,000 hryvni (UAH).  She wants to build an additional greenhouse to be able to grow more tomatoes.  Since they still have undeveloped land where it will be possible to build two more greenhouses, Larisa looks forward to working together again in the future.

loans.use: to build one more green house for raising tomatoes

loans.name: Junior

texts.es: Júnior, de 21 años, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en su casa propia. El trabajo de Júnior, consiste en la venta de comidas, su labor se inicia muy temprano con la compra de los ingredientes que usa en la preparación de los platos. Tiene un pequeño restaurante en donde atiende a su clientela por las noches. Su establecimiento esta ubicado en una zona muy concurrida por lo que siempre sus ventas son favorables. Complementa sus comidas con la venta de refrescantes bebidas envasadas o refrescos elaborados con frutas regionales. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad hace 2 años, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su cónyuge o de su hermana. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 400, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.  Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes para elaborar sus platillos como arroz, condimentos, pollos, carnes, salchichas, verduras, frutas para refrescos, papas y otros.
texts.en: Júnior is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in their own home.  Júnior sells meals and begins his work very early, purchasing the ingredients he uses to prepare his dishes.  He has a small restaurant where he serves his customers in the evenings.  His establishment is located in a very busy area so his sales are always favorable.  To compliment his meals, he sells canned soft drinks and sodas made with regional fruits.  He has been working in this activity for two years, and sometimes gets help from his spouse or his sister.  At this time, he is requesting S/. 400, and he is grateful for the opportunity provided to him so that he can realize his business plans.  In addition, he promises to make his payments on time.  With the requested amount, he will purchase ingredients such as rice, spices, chicken, meat, sausage, vegetables, fruits for soft drinks, potatoes, and other items for the preparation of his dishes.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, spices, chicken, and other items.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 45 years old and a mother of four. She engages in selling snacks in her community to help her husband in generating more income. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to finance the education of her children. 

She plans to improve and strengthen her business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy coconut pie, coconut juice, boiled corn, and peanuts to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut pie, coconut juice, boiled corn, and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is a 49-year-old married woman who works in agriculture to make her living. Sokhorn has a few pieces of land, where she grows and harvests rice to sell. Sokhorn has two cows, which she uses to maintain the rice fields. She has been a farmer for more than 23 years and earns approximately 2.50 USD per day. Sokhorn is a very hardworking woman who seeks ways of improving her current business to make sure that she will provide enough for the household.

Sokhorn is acquiring this loan to buy a used motorcycle for her employed children, who are working in Phnom Penh. This motorcycle will allow them to reduce unnecessary costs incurred by them in commuting to work. In the future, Sokhorn is aiming to further develop her agricultural businesses to make sure that she'll have a high rice production that she can sell in the markets at a good price. Sokhorn was photographed in the photo with her husband in front of their house located in Kampong Thom Province.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her employed children, who are working in Phnom Penh.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es: Doña Claudia tiene tres hijos y es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y visuteria, el cual le ha generado buenos ingresos para su familia. Esta agradecida con kiva y Micrédito ya que logro comprar más productos y así brindar una diversidad de mercadería. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niño entre otros, con el fin de ofertar nuevos productos y crecer su demanda de clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que obtendrá un nivel más alto de clientes y tendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Claudia has three children and comes from the city of Granada. She is a salesperson and she is primarily in the business of selling soft drinks and costume jewelry, a line of work which generates a good income for her family. She is thankful to Kiva and Micrédito as they have allowed her to buy more products and offer a wider variety of merchandise. She is asking for a new loan to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing, among others, with the goal of selling her new line of products and increasing customer demand. She believes that this loan will help her achieve a greater customer base and greater income.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a 48-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has eight children. She earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area.

 Elpedia requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil and margarine, to increase her production and thus her income. In the future, Elpedia would like to expand her business to support her family and to save to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and margarine.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a married man from Talibon, Bohol. He earns a living through his sari-sari (or retail store) in his place. He sells various items like eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, and beverages. 

Francisco is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, biscuits, snack foods, noodles, soap and toiletries, and others. With this, he will be able to improve his stocks, thus allowing him to attract more buyers in his store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, noodles, toiletries, and others

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 56-year-old widow with grown children living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. For 20 years she has been operating a sari-sari store that sells seasonings, biscuits, toiletries, noodles and canned goods.

Norma wants to expand her store, but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy noodles, canned goods, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, Norma will be able to improve the stock of her store which will attract more buyers and customers.

In the future, Norma plans to buy more products and items that she does not now carry to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman and a mother of five young children from Talibon, Bohol. Luisa has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Luisa is requesting a loan with CEVI, a microfinance partner in the Philippines, to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage. With this loan, they will be able to enhance their daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Luisa hopes to improve their business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family like for their food and to pay their bills on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Наталья закупила семена, пленку, удобрения.
Однако, в этом году многие  фермеры – соседи Натальи пострадали от аномальных заморозков. Наталье также пришлось весной  спасать посаженные огурцы, но это ей не удалось,  все померзло. Она высадила новую рассаду. В последствии все же удалось вырастить хороший урожай, но позже чем планировали. А это значит, что прибыль была меньше планируемой… Но Наталья не отчаялась! Она очень жизнерадостный человек. 

Чтобы увеличить свой доход в следующем году, Наталья планирует построить на своем участке дополнительную теплицу, для этого она просит предоставить ей кредит  30,000 гривен. У нее также есть планы и на будущий год, хотелось бы сделать отопление. Наталья надеется на хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan, Natalya bought seed, plastic greenhouse covering, and fertilizer.  However, this year like many farmers, Natalya and her neighbors suffered from unseasonable frosts.  In the spring, Natalya tried to save her cucumbers, but nonetheless they all froze.  So she replanted and was able to reap a good harvest, but later than she had planned.  This means that her profits were less than planned.  But Natalya didn't give up hope--she is a very up-beat person.

In order to increase her income next year, Natalya is planning to build an additional greenhouse on her land, for which she is requesting a loan of 30,000 hryvni (UAH).  She also has plans to install heating in her greenhouses next year.  Natalya is hoping for a good harvest.

loans.use: to build one more green house

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Родители с детства старались передать Сергею свой опыт, привить любовь к земле. Сейчас Сергей трудится вместе со своей семьей. У него есть большие теплицы,  где он выращивает высокорослые помидоры.  В семье подрастает сын которому он также как и его родители хочет передать свои знания.

В развитии бизнеса Сергею существенно помогают кредиты. Он уже пользовался КИВА кредитом для благоустройства теплиц. В этом году Сергей хочет осуществить свою мечту, провести отопление. Котел у него уже есть, а на шланги и прочие материалы для отопления ему нужно 30,000 гривен.

Сергей ожидает, что в следующем году доход значительно увеличится. Но он не собирается останавливаться на достигнутом, планирует  приобрести дополнительный  земельный участок и построить там теплицы, поэтому надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Starting in his childhood, Sergei's parents worked to pass on their experience to him and to instill in him a love for the land.  Today, Sergei and his family work together.  He has large greenhouses where he raises tall-growing tomatoes.  He has a son to whom he wants to pass on his knowledge, just like his parents did with him.  

Sergei's loans have helped him significantly with the development of his business.  He has already used a loan through Kiva to upgrade his greenhouses.  This year, Sergei wants to fulfill his dream to install a heating system.  He already has the boiler, but he needs 30,000 hryvni (UAH) for hoses and other parts for the heating system.  

Sergei expects his income to increase substantially next year.  But he is not about to rest on his laurels.  Since he plans to buy another plot of land where he will build greenhouses, he is looking forward to working together again in the future.

loans.use: to install a heating system in his greenhouses

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está divorciada y vive en compañía de sus 05 hijos de 13, 09, 06, 04 y 03 años de edad, en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Sadith es la repostería, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, donde le enseñaron a elaborar deliciosas tortas, y pasteles para promociones, bodas y demás acontecimientos sociales, llegando a tener muchos pedidos por el buen trabajo que realiza, y continua actualizándose pues considera que siempre  hay cosas nuevas que  aprender, contando con un horno en su casa, donde realiza todos su preparaciones y atiende a sus clientes desde hace 05 años. Le gusta  la repostería así como las manualidades, se siente a gusto con su oficio pues le ha proporcionado muchas satisfacciones, como los ingresos económicos y el poder convertirse  en una prospera empresaria. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 400 nuevos soles comprará ingredientes para la preparacion de sus tortas para esta campaña de de promociones de los colegios. También en moldes y utensilios de repostería.
texts.en:
Sadith, 33 years old, is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She is divorced and lives with her five children, ages 13, 8, 6, 4, and 3 in their own home.  Sadith runs a pastry shop, work that she learned in a job training center. They taught her to make delicious cakes and pies for graduation, weddings, and other social occasions. She has come to have many orders because of the good work she does. She relies primarily on her home oven, where for the last five years she has done all of her preparations and waited on her customers. 

She likes the pastry business because it's hands-on work. She says there are always new things for her to learn. She's pleased with her line of work and it has brought her great satisfaction, not least her financial earnings and the ability to become a profitable businessperson.  This is her third loan through Kiva and she is happy with the financial support that has helped her advance her business. With the requested loan of 400 nuevos soles, she will buy the ingredients she needs to bake the cakes that have been ordered for the high school graduation season. She will also purchase molds and other pastry utensils.

loans.use: buy ingredients to bake cakes and supply her business.

loans.name: Andres Enrique

texts.es: Don Andrés, es un señor de 58 años de edad, habita en una humilde vivienda, ubicada en un barrio de Managua, su actividad comercial es la venta ambulante de productos químicos de limpieza para el hogar, con el apoyo de su esposa, siendo su medio de transporte un triciclo con el que sale a diario por las calles a vender, de esta manera se gana la vida don Andrés. El solicita el crédito para abastecerse con mas productos para poder mejorar su economía, con el préstamo comprara detergente, cloro, pinesol, acido moliatico, creolina.
texts.en:
Andrés, 58 years old, lives in a humble home in a neighborhood of Managua. His main work is the traveling sales of household cleaning chemicals. With the help of his wife and using a tricycle that is his primary means of transportation, he head out to the streets every day to sell his products. This is how he earns his living. 

The loan that he is requesting will be used to restock his business with more products, which will improve his sales. Specifically, he will purchase detergents, bleach, PineSol, muriatic acid, and Creolina, a disinfectant.

loans.use: buy cleaning products for resale.

loans.name: Lilian Marcela

texts.es: Marcela nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 24 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella después hacer las actividades del hogar se dedica  a la venta de cerveza pues tiene un pequeño local donde expende sus productos, ella es una joven trabajadora y responsable y por ese motivo le invitaron para participar del banco comunal “COMUZONE III” entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Marcela was born in Cusco.  She is 24 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has one son.  She has a small location where she sells beer, after doing her household chores.  She is a responsible, hardworking young woman, and for this reason, she was invited to participate in the “Comuzone III” Communal Bank.  So, at this time, she needs the loan to purchase more beer.  She is thankful to all the investors for the loan and she promises to be very responsible and make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more beer.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
Gurban is 47 years old, married, with three children. His family lives in the Baku region. Gurban’s wife is a housewife. His elder daughter finished school, his other daughter goes to class eleven, and his son studies second course at college. 

Gurban is a master: he sets, paints, and repairs iron doors and windows. Now he wants to increase his business, therefore Gurban has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy a new device which will be useful in his business and new paint colors for doors and windows. 

Gurban is very thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations and lenders for help. In the future he wants to hire a painter for his business.

loans.use: to buy a new device to help with his door and window business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 4 hijos, ella es madre soltera, muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Aurora no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y eso la imposibilito a estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Aurora se dedica a la agricultura, ella cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra yuca y otros cultivos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y dedicación.
Aurora se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de riesgo, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, para luego conseguir una buena venta, así pues Aurora seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurora is a woman, 51 years old, living in the city of Pucallpa with her four children. She is a hard working single mother who strives to help her family get ahead. Unfortunately due to the lack of resources and the need to work since she was very young, Aurora was unable to finish primary school. This meant it was impossible for her to have a professional career.

On her own initiative, Aurora became a farmer. She has a small lot where she plants cassava and other crops. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that she is doing well due to her experience and dedication. 

Aurora is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will cover the expenses of irrigating, fertilizing and harvesting her crops so that she can sell at a good price. Thus she will be able to continue working and striving to fulfill her great dream of owning a dwelling that is adequate and safe for her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of caring for her crops.

loans.name: Mirian Yamileth

texts.es: Mirian,  de 28 años, esta casada, tiene un hijo, reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara  junto a su esposo e hijo. Ella estuvo trabajando como empleada domestica por varios años, y ha decidido tener su propio negocio de venta de mercadería. Vende alhajas de oro y plata como aretes, anillos, cadenas, pulseras etc.  Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y mediante pedidos. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar más producto para la venta, tiene encargos de cadenas, aretes, pulseras, anillos de oro. Considera que va poder aprovechar la temporada de fin de años para aumentar los ingresos.  Su meta es tener siempre el negocio y estar junto a su familia.
texts.en: Mirian is 28 years old. She is married and has a son. She lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara, together with her husband and son. She worked as a domestic employee for a number of years, and then decided to have her own business selling merchandise. She sells gold and silver jewelry such as earrings, rings, chains, bracelets, etc. She makes her sales as a street vendor and through orders. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Lempiras to buy more products to sell. She has orders for chains, earrings, bracelets, and gold rings. She reasons that she is going to be able to take advantage of the season at the end of the year to increase her income. Her goal is to always have her business and be together with her family.

loans.use: to buy chains, earrings, bracelets, and gold rings to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a married man and a father of five children from Talibon, Bohol. His work is fishing. He catches fish and crabs and sells them to the community. He has been in fishing for almost 12 years. 

Jose is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch, which he can then sell to the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. They have four children. Her husband works as a fisherman. Regina sells her husband's daily catch. 

Regina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish stock to sell in the market. 

For the future, Regina dreams of making her business a success, so that it will generate more income for the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a farmer living in the highland area of Kericho, which is a very rich area for agriculture. He is married and has two children, both of whom are of school-going age. Their main source of income is farming; he produces and sells milk, eggs and tea. He has been doing farming for 10 years. He really invests more in dairy farming, but the challenge he faces is how to get the dairy feeds for his cattle.

Gilbert chose Juhudi Kilimo for this dairy loan because he has seen their loans assist many farmers in the area, and he wants to invest in dairy farming. This loan will assist his family by bringing in more income to the business, which will in turn uplift their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en:
Casimera is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol, in the Philippines. Casimera works with her husband in the farm. They have been in the farming business for more than 10 years now.

Casimera is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. With this loan, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm. In the future, Casimera has hopes of expanding their farm so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She is running a beauty salon business in her house. She is making a good income from the beauty salon, and she wants to buy hair clippers, hair wash, and a hair puller, along with other needed items. She is living in a town near the main road, and, thus, many people come to her beauty salon, which she opens every day. She opened her business two years ago with her own working capital of 50 USD.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers, hair wash, and a hair puller.

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. Eutiquia earns a living through her hog-raising business. 

She has been raising pigs for several years now. Eutiquia is asking for a loan to buy feed and repair her pig pen so her pigs can live and grow healthy in it.

Eutiquia dreams of expanding her business in the future so that it will generate the revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair her pig pen

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María Antonia es una joven de 23 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, casada y madre de un hijo con una edad de 2 años. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el 3 grado ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarla y darle la oportunidad de convertirse en profesional. Desde muy temprana edad se dedicó a la caficultura aprendiendo de su padre las técnicas necesarias para sembrar, fortalecer, cultivar y cortar el grano para posteriormente lavarlo secarlo y despulparlo para posteriormente venderlo a los compradores que llegan de todos los alrededores de la zona. El terreno que ella y su esposo trabaja fue obtenido gracias a una herencia por parte del padre el cual está ubicado a 20 minutos desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminado.
Sus sueños son poder ampliar sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra y generar mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar apoyando a su único hijo en sus estudios para que él pueda asistir a la universidad y pueda prepararse y tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Por lo que hoy día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder invertir y asistir sus cultivos de café, mismos que ayudan al final de cada temporada al fortalecimiento económico de la familia.
texts.en:
María Antonia is a young woman of 23 years of age. She is a homemaker, a farmer, a wife, and a mother of a two-year-old son. She stayed in school through the third grade since her parents, people of few means, could not support her or provide her with the opportunity to become a professional. Ever since she was very young, she has been in the business of raising coffee, having learned from her father the necessary techniques for planting, fertilizing, growing and harvesting the bean so that it could then be washed, dried, and depulped, and then finally sold to the various buyers that come from all over the region. The land that she and her husband work is theirs partly thanks to an inheritance from her father; it is located twenty minutes walking from their home.

María Antonia dreams of expanding her coffee plantings by buying more land, thus increasing her income for her family and home and helping her only son to complete his schooling and attend university. He will be able to prepare himself to have greater opportunities in life.

The loan that she is requesting today will be used to buy agricultural supplies which she will invest in her coffee fields. These will be what helps strengthen her family's economic situation at the end of the season.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.ru: Аминчону 24 года. Он не женатый парень. Аминичон с семьей живет на районе Хамадони. Его отца нет в живых. Мама Аминчона занимается растениеводством. Его брат находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Аминчон живет с мамой. В течение 1 года Аминчон работает преподавателем в местной школе. Параллельно он предоставляет услугу такси. Активный молодой человек и он еще дополнительно занимается скотоводством. Аминчон не боится трудностей и уверен что со всеми обязательствами справиться на 100%. Но к сожалению для покупки скотов у Аминчона не хватает денег и он просит у Вас помощи!
texts.en:
Aminjon is 24 years old and a bachelor.  Aminjon lives with his mother in the Hamadoni region.  His father is deceased.  Aminjon's mother is a farmer.  His brother moved to Russia to work.  Aminjon has been a teacher at a local school for 1 year.  He also offers taxi services.  He is an energetic young man and besides all this, he also raises cattle.   

Aminjon isn't afraid of difficulties and he is confident that he can handle all his responsibilities at 100%.  But unfortunately, he doesn't have the money to buy cattle and he is asking you for help!

loans.use: to buy a couple head of cattle

loans.name: Chrystell Brigette

texts.es: Chrystell nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 21 años de edad, ella es soltera y su actividad económica principal es la venta de Juguetes en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad, ella es una joven trabajadora y responsable y por ese motivo le invitaron ha participar del banco comunal “COMUZONE III” entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar juguetes para esta campaña navideña. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Chrystell was born in the city of Cusco. She is 21 years old and single. Her main line of work is selling toys in one of the popular markets in the city. She is hard-working and responsible young woman, which is why she was invited to join the communal bank "COMUZONE III."  Her current opportunity requires a loan to buy more toys in preparation for the Christmas season. She is thankful to all her investors for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time and responsibly.

loans.use: purchase toys for resale for the Christmas season

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa de 42 años de edad es una mujer luchadora que día a día se levanta muy temprano para dar el sustento a sus hijos. Rosa habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos de 18 años, 15 años, 10 años y  6 años de edad. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de carne de res y de cerdo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Este negocio es el que le permite llevar el sustento y junto a su compañero de vida llevan la economía del hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, grava, lámina y madera para encementar el piso de la vivienda y construir el baño que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: Rosa is 42 years old and is a very feisty woman.  Every day she gets up very early to bring in an income to support her children.  Rosa lives in her own house with her husband and four children, aged 18, 15, 10 and 6 years each.  Rosa has been earning a living selling beef and pork for the last three years.  She is a street vendor and sells in the busiest parts of town.  It is this business that allows Rosa to take home an income and, along with her husband, they can support the household.  Rosa wants to improve her and her family's living conditions and so it applying for this loan from FUSAI in order to buy sand, cement, gravel, laminate sheeting, and wood, in order to cement the floor in her home and to build the bathroom that they so greatly need.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, laminate sheeting, and wood, in order to cement the floor in her home and to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Siquibal Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmela Mirtala es de estado civil casada. Tiene 42 años de edad. Cursó 3 años de educación primaria. Tiene 3 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos. Inició este negocio con 2 cerdos y a la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar 2 marranos y 4 docenas de pollos. Desea en el futuro tener una granja grande.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al la crianza de animales domésticos. 

En la fotografía aparecen 9 integantes, pero, solo a 7 se le concedío el préstamo.
texts.en:
Carmela Mirtala is married and is 42 years old. She completed three years of primary school. She has 3 children, one of whom is in school. She raises domestic animals. She started out with two pigs and has eight years of experience now.

Carmela Mirtala organized a group and is requesting a loan to buy 2 pigs and 4 dozen chickens.
In the future she hopes to have a large farm.

The rest of the group also raises domestic animals. Nine members appear in the photo but only seven are participating in this loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ana Milagro

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad reside en condiciones  muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar constituido por su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 13 años, 8 años, 3 años y 1 año de edad. Junto a su compañero de vida llevan la economía del hogar y juntos van tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Actualmente no cuenta con agua potable por lo que desea construir un pozo ya que el terreno donde habita es húmedo y el agua se encuentra a pocos metros de profundidad y de esta manera desea resolver esta situación que tanto les preocupa. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava y tubos para la elaboración del pozo que tanta falta le hace y de esta forma tener a la mano el vital líquido.
texts.en: Ana Milagro is 32 years old and lives in very humble conditions with her family.  She has a partner and four children, aged 13, 8, 3, and 1 years old.  Together with her partner, Ana is able to cover household costs and the couple is trying to improve the family's living conditions.  The family does not currently have running water and so they want to build a well as the land where they live is very humid and there is water just a few metres underground.  This well can stop the family having to worry about not having water.  Ana is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel and pipes in order to build the well she so greatly needs and thus have this vital liquid available in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and pipes in order to build the well she so greatly needs.

loans.name: Zayton

texts.en:
This is Zayton, age 46 and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Esmael, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their variety store business. Zayton is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Zayton earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Zayton dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Talibon, Bohol. Emma earns an income by buying and selling household wares such as blankets, mats, and kitchen utensils.
 
Emma is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell, such as chopping dishes, floor mats, and similar household wares. With this, she will be able to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as chopping dishes, floor mats, and similar household wares

loans.name: Elmira

texts.es: Elmira tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y tiene una hija con quien vive en su casa propia. Elmira se dedica a la agricultura, se dedica al sembrío, producción  y venta de granos de cacao y plátano, con experiencia de 05 años en el rubro, se inició con esta actividad a raíz que su padre era agricultor, le inculcaron desde temprana edad el oficio de la agricultura en el sembrío de cacao y maíz. El principal problema en esta actividad es la fuerte variación que sufre el precio de los granos cacao y maíz en época de campaña, Pero gracias a su experiencia y a sus conocimientos ha sabido sacar adelante la producción, lo que ahora espera es aumentar las parcelas del cultivo, cambiar la producción normal por una producción de cacao con certificación orgánica. Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que está muy agradecido y contenta por el apoyo económico recibido y la oportunidad  de  seguir creciendo. El dinero solicitado de S/.1000.00 está destinado para la compra de abono orgánico y mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Elmira is 32 years old , she is married, and she has a daughter who lives separately in her own home. Elmira works in agriculture. She grows and sells cacao beans and plaintains. She has five years experience in the field. She got into this work because her father was a farmer, and he got her into agricultural work from an early age, planting cacao and maize. The principal problem in this work is the strong variation that the price of cacao grain and corn can suffer during the season, but thanks to her experience and knowledge she has been able to get ahead with her production, and her goal now is to increase the plots she can cultivate and change her standard production to a certified organic cacao production. This is her first loan with Kiva, an economic assistance and chance to continue growing for which she is happy and grateful. She is requesting S/. 1000.00 which will be used to purchase organic fertilizer and maintain her harvests.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer and maintain her lands.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño con quien vive en su casa propia.
Liliana se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles,  como  actividad complementaria para obtener otros ingresos se dedica al sembrío y venta de arroz a riego. El problema que tenían antes de tener el negocio fue la separación de su esposo, esto le enfermo emocionalmente, logro superar por ser una persona muy perseverante, logrando  construir su  negocio. Gracias a esta actividad mejoro la calidad de vida de su familia.
Liliana  comenta que este es el primer crédito de Kiva, y está muy agradecido por el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Liliana solicito S/.1500 soles para la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Lilliana is a 34-year-old single mother of one child, and they live in their own home.  Her primary work is selling groceries, which earns her money alongside her other work of planting and selling rice. Her main problem before starting her business was her separation from her husband, which had led to emotional pain. She managed to overcome it, though, as she is a persevering person, and she began her business. Thanks to this work, she was able to improve her family's quality of life.

Lilliana remarked that this is her first loan through Kiva and she is very grateful for the economic support she has received. She promises to make her payments on time. She is requesting a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles which she will use to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk and more.

loans.use: purchase foodstuffs like rice, sugar and milk to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Marvin Arely

texts.es: Marvin es una mujer de 28 años de edad bendecida con tres hijos de 5 años, 10 años y 13 años de edad. Habita en casa sencilla pero propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus queridos hijos. Marvin trabaja en un vivero cercano a su localidad y de esa forma lleva el sustento a su casa y le ayuda a su compañero de vida con los gastos. Marvin es una mujer visionaria quien desea mejorar sus condiciones poco a poco. Debido a que la cubierta del techo de su vivienda se encuentra en mal estado desea invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera ya que cuando llueve se filtra el agua y se dañan sus pocas pertenencias. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Marvin is a 28-year-old woman who is blessed with three children, ages 5, 10 and 13. She lives in a simple home with her partner and their beloved children, but it is their own home.  Marvin works at a garden center near her village and manages to meet her household needs, helping her partner with the expenses. Marvin is a woman with a dream, who hopes to improve her living situation a little at a time. 

The roof of their home is in poor condition, so she wants to invest in sheets of corrugated steel, nails, and wood to prevent the water from getting in when it rains and damaging their few belongings. This is why she is requesting this loan through FUSAI, which she will use to repair their roof. She affirms that she will be able to pay back the loan per its terms.

loans.use: buy corrugated steel, nails and wood to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana habita en condiciones muy sencillas y humildes junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 10 años, 7 años, 2 años y 3 meses de edad.  Ana es una mujer admirable ya que junto a su esposo trabaja muy duro en la agricultura para sacar el sustento para su familia. Su principal patrimonio es su vivienda la cual con mucho esfuerzo han logrado construir. Actualmente las paredes de su casa son de bahareque las cuales no se encuentran en buen estado y cuando llueve no dan el soporta adecuado. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para hacer el cambio de paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana lives in very simple and humble conditions together with her husband and children aged 10, 7, 2 and a 3 month old baby. Ana is an admirable woman who together with her husband works very hard at farming in order to support her family. Her main inheritance is her house, which was constructed with a lot of effort. At present the walls are made of mud and wattle and are in poor condition. They can't withstand the rain.

With the goal of improving her living conditions Ana is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to replace the walls of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to replace the walls of her house.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is a young and industrious woman. She is 21 years old. Guldasta lives with her parents in a village in Northern Tajikistan. 

She has a business growing vegetables and crops. She sells her harvest in the local market. Guldasta is the owner of the business. Her parents help her with managing the business. Their only source of income is from agriculture activity. They live poorly. 

Guldasta wants to repair their old house but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni for building materials such as cement, wood, etc. for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials like cement, wood, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 28 años de edad,  él es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, él es estudiante de antropología en uno de las universidades de la ciudad antes mencionada pero por las noches se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi así esta forma saca adelante a su familia. Unos amigos del banco comunal "COMUZONE III" le invitaron a participar por ser una persona responsable y emprendedora. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro pues es tiene que estar en perfectas condiciones ya que es su herramienta de trabajo y su ingreso económico principal. Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y promete pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan José was born in Cusco and is 28 years old. He is married and has two children, fruit of this beautiful union. He is an anthropology student at one of the Universities in the city and at night he works driving a taxi in order to get his family ahead. Some friends from the "COMUZONE III" communal bank invited him to join the institute as he is a responsible and enterprising individual.

At this time Juan José needs a loan to do maintenance on his vehicle. It has to be in perfect condition as it is his instrument for work and his principal economic source of income. He thanks the lenders for the support and promises to pay his installments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan is a 42-year-old married woman with four single children. She works on a few plots of land growing rice and yams to earn a living. She has been in this occupation for almost 15 years and earns approximately $6.40 per day. In each harvest season, local traders in the region often come into the village to buy agricultural products from villagers. Agribusiness is an important source of income for her family. 

Khan has requested a loan amounting to 560 US dollars to build a household latrine to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. With the loan support, Khan hopes that everyone in her family can live in a comfortable lifestyle. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo anterior pues le fue muy bien y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la compra y venta de productos desechables pero en esta oportunidad se va dedicar a la venta de cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, colares, aretes, anillos y ropa solo por esta campaña navideña y por ese razón desea comprar perfumes, ropa, aretes y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Yaneth is thankful to all the lenders on her previous loan, because it went very well for her and she feels happy about the support she received. She continues to buy and sell disposable products, but on this occasion she is going to work on selling cosmetic items, like perfume, necklaces, earrings, rings and clothes. This will only be for the Christmas season. For this reason, she would like to buy perfume, clothes, earrings, and other items.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothes, earrings, and other items for resale.

loans.name: El Arbolito 4   (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  El Arbolito 4, grupo formado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres que hace tiempo atrás se unieron y formaron este grupo el cual les ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante con sus negocios y a su vez darles algo mejor a sus familias.
La señora Genith es parte de este grupo, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos mayores de edad, 3 de ellos estudian en universidad. El esposo es taxista. 
Doña Genith con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarles a sus hijos en sus estudios se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, edredones, toallas y varios productos más, ella salea recorrer por la localidad en los momentos que está desocupada, cuenta con muy buena clientela la misma que ha logrado conseguir en los 7 años que lleva con este negocio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar sabanas, edredones, toallas, entre otros productos que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y espera seguir por mucho tiempo recibiendo los créditos. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, known for years for its airport, Reales Tamarindos, the members of the group "Grupo de Crédito El Arbolito 4" meet every fifteen days. The group was founded by 11 woman and 2 men some time ago with the goal of helping its members get ahead with their businesses and provide their family with better at the same time.

One member of this group is Genith, a woman of 47 years of age, who is married and has four grown children, three of whom are studying at the university. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Genith's intention was to earn something herself and use that to help her children with their schooling. Her business is selling sheets, quilts, towels, and similar products. She travels throughout her neighborhood in her free time and is able to rely on a very strong customer base, which she has obtained through her seven years of experience in this business.

This loan will be used to purchase more household linens, among other products which she sells. She has been in the group since the beginning and she hopes to continue receiving these loans for a long time. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: buy sheets, quilts, towels, and more

loans.name: Dema

texts.en:
Dema is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, and the loan also assisted the education of her children. Her income from business is supporting their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dema hopes for the continuous success of her business and desires for her family to be closer to God. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business with her husband for more than six years, and this is the source of their income. Evangeline is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. This will help her husband improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Evangeline dreams of expanding their business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family like to buy food and to pay for the bills.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en: Dancille is 51 years old. She is married with ten children aged between seven and twenty-seven years. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. With this Kiva loan, she will buy more bananas, maize and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family. She is very thankful for the previous loan which boosted her business. She is still focused on improving her business on a high level.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, maize and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia tiene 30 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo. Es originaria de la ciudad de Nandaime, Carazo. De oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, con ayuda de su hermano quien le presto dinero para que lo invirtiera en un negocio; luego poco a poco iba comprando mercadería. Desde entonces con las ganancias obtenidas compraba productos y así crecer en el negocio. Hoy en día cuenta con su pulpería muy prospera. Su meta es implementar nuevos productos para que cada vez crezca la clientela. Solicita un crédito para comprar: gaseosas, jabones, arroz, azúcar, pan, café, entre otros, con el fin de incrementar sus productos. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá incrementar su clientela y crecer su negocio. Su plan futuro es extender su negocio a una miscelánea y así ofrecer de todo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 30 years old, married, and the mother of one son.  She is originally from the city of Nandaime, Carazo.  For her craft, she devotes herself to the business of a small grocery.  She started the business a few years ago with the help of her brother who lent her money to invest in a business.  Little by little she went shopping for merchandise.  Since then with the earnings obtained she has bought products and in this way grows her business.  Today her small grocery is very successful.

Her goal is to incorporate new products to continually increase her clientele.  She seeks a loan to purchase sodas, soaps, rice, sugar, bread, coffee, etc. with the goal of expanding her products.  She estimates that the loan will be beneficial as it can increase her clientele and grow her business.  Her future plan is to extend the business into a general store and offer a little of everything.

loans.use: to purchase soda, soap, rice, sugar, bread, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet Mabinty, she is a 30-year-old from Waterloo, the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child.  In 2007, Mabinty established her wood selling business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself.   She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase bags of wood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to open a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Alianca

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is requested by Alianca to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, and biscuits. She has been involving herself in these business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Alianca independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola and biscuits

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en: Gantugs, 33 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. His elder daughter is ten years old and goes to elementary school. His wife stays at home and looks after their younger daughter. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy furniture such as a sofa and drawers. This new furniture will decorate his inner house component and enable the family to live in a comfortable place. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as a sofa and drawers.

loans.name: Reyna Edith

texts.es: Reyna es una joven de 20 años de edad quien se encuentra acompañada y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Reyna se dedica a la venta de tortillas (preparación alimenticia a base de maíz), y este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que con lo que gana su compañero de vida en las actividades agrícolas no les alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. Su vivienda es muy humilde construida a base de lámina la cual desea reparar ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias se ha deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para sustituir las existentes y mejorar lo antes posible las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Reyna is a young woman of 20 years who lives together with her partner and her family in their own home. Reyna works selling tortillas (which she makes from corn), and this is her primary source of income now since the income that her husband makes as a farmer are not sufficient to cover all the costs of their household. Her home is very humble and is made from sheet metal, which has deteriorated with the rain and is in need of repair. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to purchase galvanized sheet metal, lumber, and nails to replace the existing panels and improve the walls of her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet metal, lumber, and nails to repair the walls of her home.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad es madre  soltera  y habita junto a su hija de 18 años de edad en casa de su propiedad. María se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y además vende ropa en diferentes zonas de su localidad. Es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y visionaria. En la actualidad no cuenta con agua potable, por lo que se vio obligada a construir un pozo dentro de su casa el cual en la actualidad necesita una mayor perforación para tener el agua más a la mano. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de tubos de cemento y pago de la mano de obra para ahondar más el pozo que tantos beneficios le da a ella y su familia.
texts.en: Maria, 49, is a single mother and lives with her 18-year-old daughter in a house of her own. Maria works providing domestic help and also sells clothes in different areas of her town. She is an enterprising, responsible and visionary woman. Maria doesn't have potable water, so she was forced to build a well inside her house. She now needs to dig deeper to have more water handy. That is why she is asking for this loan to our lending partner, FUSAI. She will invest the money in the purchase of cement pipes and to pay for the labor cost of deepening the well that provides so many benefits for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement pipes and pay labor costs to deepen a well.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 26 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años Ana trabaja en la corta de caña de azúcar y de esta forma junto a su compañero de vida llevan la economía del hogar. Su vivienda es muy sencilla construida a base de plástico la cual desea cambiar por algo más seguro. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar las débiles paredes con las que cuenta su humilde vivienda, expresa que junto a su compañero de vida podrán hacer frente al pago de las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Ana, age 26, lives in her own house with her life partner and her little nine year old son.  Ana has been working cutting sugarcane for three years.  This way she and her life partner manage the household finances together.

Her house is very simple, and it is built from plastic.  She wishes to change this for something more secure. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails in order to change the weak walls of her humble house.  She states that, together, she and her life partner will be able to make the payments on the loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails in order to change the weak walls of her humble house.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 1 year, Annet has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for sale, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and take care of her medical bills. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to become a very powerful businesswoman in the area. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase for more charcoal for sale,

loans.name: Agella

texts.en:
Agella is 22 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children,  2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Agella has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Agella has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for the hotel, helping Agella to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Agella hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses of her own. 

Agella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for the hotel.

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña guadalupe o Lupita, como le dicen en su comunidad, es una mujer alegre muy amable con las otras personas pero sobretodo muy trabajadora tiene 43 años de edad está casada desde hace 25 años con el señor Leobardo desde hace 25 años juntos formaron una familia con tres hijos de los cuales ya no dependen de dicha pareja. Doña Lupita se dedica  a la elaboración de gorros, bufandas, guantes, capas, calentadores y medias  de estambre desde hace 20 años platica que inició su actividad porque en la comunidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la elaboración de estas artesanías es muy típico que las personas se dediquen a tejer estos artículos para después venderlas Doña Lupita comento “En mi familia es una tradición de generaciones saber bordar” Doña Lupita aprendió hacer los puntos porque su esposo le enseño, durante todo el año ellos se dedican a elaborar estos productos pero desafortunadamente su trabajo no es valorado porque su pago es muy poco sin embrago está solicitando un crédito para comprar estambre para la elaboración de sus bordados, porque en esta temporada como cada año sale a otra ciudad para vender su artesanía es de la mejor manera para obtener mejores ganancias aunque es muy riesgoso viajar a esas ciudades. La dificultad por la cual atraviesa Doña Lupita es la falta de dinero para surtir mas mercancía y comprar más estambre porque en el lugar donde vende sus clientes le piden prendas especiales y necesitara de estambre de varios colores, Doña Lupita platica que sus modelos y la combinación de los colores las obtiene observando cómo se visten las personas, Doña Lupita está muy única con su tía juntas han planeado abrir nuevos negocios de ropa en general y tienda de abarrotes Doña Lupita atenderá los dos negocios porque ya no puede salir a trabajar a lugares más lejos porque  está enferma tiene una lesión en la espalda.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, or Lupita, as she is known in her community, is a happy woman who is very kind to other people.  But most of all, she is very hardworking.  She is 43 years old, and has been married for 25 years to Leobardo.  Twenty-five years ago they formed a family with 3 daughters who are no longer their dependents.  Lupita has had a business making caps, scarves, gloves, capes, legwarmers, and other woolen items for 20 years.  She says that she started the business because in her community many people work making these kinds of handicrafts, and it is very common for the people to knit these items and later sell them.  Lupita comments that "in my family, knowledge of embroidery has been passed down through the generations."  

Lupita's husband taught her to stitch.  She makes these products all through the year, but unfortunately her work is not valued, because her pay is very little.  However, she is requesting a loan to buy wool yarn to make her embroidered products, because in this season of every year, she goes to another city to sell her handicrafts.  This is the best way for her to obtain the highest earnings, although it is very risky to travel to these cities.  The difficulty that Lupita is experiencing is that she lacks the money to stock up on merchandise and buy more yarn.  In the place where she sells, her customers ask for special garments, and she needs wool in various colors.  Lupita tells us that she develops her styles and color combinations by observing how people dress, and her work is very unique.  With her aunt, she has plans to open new businesses, including the sale of clothing and a grocery store.  Lupita will tend to the 2 businesses, because she can not go out to work in more distant places because she suffers from a back injury.

loans.use: to buy woolen yarn, gloves, scarves, hats, etc.

loans.name: Los Rodris El Rincon Group

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela Violeta de estado civil casada. De edad 45 años. Curso los 6 años de educación primaria. Tiene 3 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de animales como marranos y pollos. Inició este negocio con 1 cerdo y 6 gallinas. A la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar gallinas y cerdos porque quiere ampliar su negocio. En el futuro desea tener una granja con su propio capital de trabajo.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales domésticos y a tienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Rafaela Violeta is 45 years old and married. She has six years of primary education. She has three children, and of these, two are still in school. She raises animals such as pigs and chickens. She started this business with one pig and six chickens. To date she has six years of experience.

She is organizing a group and requesting a loan which she will use to buy chickens and pigs, because she wants to expand her business. In the future she wishes to have a farm with her own working capital. The other members of the group raise small animals, and one has a store selling basic household necessities.

loans.use: To buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is 47 years old and a windowed mother of seven children. She lives in a peaceful village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. With the help of her children, Ra is engaged in farming and other agribusinesses. Having been in this business for years, Ra is able to earn an income of $4.00 per day to fulfill her daily living needs.

Since she doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, she has requested a loan of 560 US dollars to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 57 years old. She is a mother of five and they all go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past 13 years. She has requested a loan to repurchase more bananas for sale. She was very supported by the previous loan and the volume of her sales doubled. She used what she got from the previous loan to pay for her children's schools. With the profits from this business, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man aged 28 years old. He lives in Kyotera town with his family. He has one child who is two years old. He deals in rental business and he supplements his income with a salary which he earns from the local government.  He started his business in 2010.

Robert works 5 days in a week and 8 hours per day. He started his business to increase his family income. He is acquiring this loan to complete the construction of rentals. His clients are residents around Kyotera town.

Robert's hope for the future is to build an estate in Kyotera and his challenge is the high cost of building materials. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man who encourages lenders to reduce interest rates.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Teun

texts.en:
