She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 29 years old and is not married yet. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools, to rural farmers in their local area. 

On his land, Moses grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, potatoes, passion fruit, bananas and onions. He also has some cows and chickens. 

As a CKW, Moses will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Moses will invest in new agricultural tools. 

His biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 24-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been selling spices that are used in cooking food. She purchases spices in bulk from the wholesale market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good-quality spices in her locality and earns enough to have a decent life. 

She is a responsible mother of two children and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 28 years old, is married, and has no children yet. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Jackson grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, vegetables, bananas, and eggplants. He also has some goats and chickens. As a CKW, Jackson will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Jackson will buy a cow. His biggest dream in life is to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is married and has ten children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On his land, Stephen grows maize, beans, coffee, and onions. He also has some chickens. As a CKW, Stephen will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Stephen will open up a small shop. His biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On her land, Jackline grows maize, beans, passion fruit, vegetables, bananas, potatoes, cabbages, onions, and coffee. She also has chickens, goats, sheep, and cows. As a CKW, Jackline will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Jackline will pay school fees for her children. Her biggest dream is to be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and has one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). 

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land Mary grows maize, beans, cassava, bananas, avocadoes, mangoes, and coffee. She also has chickens and cows. 

Mary has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Mary will invest in getting a better education. 

Her biggest dream is to be a model farmer in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 30 years old and is married with three children. He earns his income through the sale of crops, livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land, Francis grows maize, beans, coffee, cabbages and bananas. He also has cows and chickens. As a CKW, Francis will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Francis will pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream in life is to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 40 years old and is married with six children. He earns his income through the sale of crops, livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land, Vincent grows beans, coffee and bananas. He also has cows, goats, pigs, rabbits and chickens. As a CKW, Vincent will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Vincent will invest in new agricultural tools. His biggest dream in life is to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 46 years old and is married with eight children. He earns his income through the sale of crops, livestock and has now started to earn a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Patrick grows maize, beans, coffee and vegetables. He also has some cows, goats and chickens. As a CKW Patrick will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Patrick will pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 45-year-old married mother of four children who works as a tailor from her house since 1993.

She is a hard working woman who puts so much effort in financially supporting her husband and family to make sure that they are getting the necessary living needs.

In addition to working as a tailor, she provides some medical services to neighbors and other customers upon request, through pricking medical needles to medicate children and any sick person who can be treated at home, and when medical syringe needles are requested.

Salam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a necessary medical machine for her son to help him in his living and make his life easier.  

She hopes to expand her business through moving her tailoring services outside her house and expecting new customers.

loans.use: to buy a necessary medical machine for her son to help him in his living and make his life easier

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 32-year-old single lady who's the sole breadwinner to three additional members of her family.

Nisrine is a hard worker who likes her business a lot. She works from her house since at the meantime she isn't financially capable of opening her own separate working place.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary newly released editing machines that will help her run her business easily, faster and produce higher quality.

She hopes that in the near future, and after investing this loan in a well managed way, she'll be capable of opening her own editing company outside her house.

loans.use: to buy necessary newly released editing machines that will help her run her business easily, faster, and produce higher quality

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 60-year-old married woman, who is the main financial support for her family. Her husband does not work at all and she works hard to better their living standards. She has operated her small convenience store since 1994. Amina sells canned food, cleaning detergents, chocolates, sweets, soft drinks, chips, cereals, and grains.

Amina is requesting her eighth loan cycle to improve her business through increasing its merchandise with special winter requested items such as cereals, hot drinks, and special treats that would benefit her customers during this cold season.

Amina hopes to stay in good health so remains capable of running her own business and making their living.

loans.use: To buy special winter requested items such as cereals, hot drinks and special treats to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 43 years old. She is married and has two children ages 22 and 19.  Many years ago, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but are raised for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Sam Eng

texts.en:
Sam Eng is 24 years old, married, and has a small child. Sam Eng currently lives with his wife and child in his own home, located in Ang Snuol district, Kandal province. Sam Eng aims to provide his family a better quality of life, so he strives to work overtime very often as a garment worker. His wife is employed in the same factory. 

The challenge for them is that they don’t have a motorcycle to commute to work, so they must pay for a taxi service every day. This may increase their daily expenses. For this reason, Sam Eng is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 700 to buy a motorcycle to satisfy their transportation needs. Sam Eng expresses his thanks to all lenders who have contributed their funds to help poor a fellow like him improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for their transportation needs.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 34 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of four and ten. She will use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to increase her maize production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase maize production.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 31-year-old single woman with four  children. She operates a retail store where she sells clothing. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local neighbors. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothing for resale. 

Her business goal is to open a well-established outlet within five years. She describes herself as a determined person and her biggest business challenge is the lack of finances. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue, con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Hace un años que ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ropa, accesorios para bebe, plásticos, ropa interior para caballeros etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende mediante pedidos también. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir el negocio de ropa, accesirios para bebe, ropa interior y plásticos, su propósito es complacer siempre a la clientela con variedad de productos. Tiene como meta seguir manteniendo activo su negocio para ayudar a sus hijos con las ganancias que le genera.
texts.en: Karla is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, has two children, and lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.  She started selling clothing, baby accessories, plastic ware, men’s undergarments, etc. two years ago.  She sells out of her home and also takes orders.  She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras so she can stock her business and always be able to please her customers with a variety of products.  Her goal is to remain active in her business so she can help her children with her earnings.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from the village of Berta. She is 31 years old and divorced with two school-aged sons. The family has only seasonal income from agricultural activities. They have a small plot of land for potato growing. The harvests are sold locally. In addition, Irma works as a dairymaid at a local farm in return for a small monthly wage. 

It’s often difficult for Irma to cover the costs of feeding her children, and that is the reason why Irma decided to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business. Irma will produce cheese for selling as well as family consuming. This loan will be a great help to Irma’s family, as it will generate income. Irma appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cow and begin dairy farming.

loans.name: Neghat

texts.en: Neghat is a 50-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Neghat was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner, as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. Neghat felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. Therefore, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She will use this loan amount to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 54-year-old married woman, and she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she requests a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On her land, Sylvia grows maize, beans, avocados, bananas, and coffee. She also has chickens, goats, and cows. Sylvia has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Sylvia will start a small business. Her biggest dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is 28 years old, married, and has two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On his land Isah grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, vegetables, bananas, and cabbages. He also has some cows, goats, bees, and chickens. As a CKW, Isah will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Isah will invest in growing more coffee. His biggest dream in life is to be an agricultural expert.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is 53 years old. He is married and has two children. Manvel lives with his family in Gyumri town. He is a kind and outgoing man. His wife is a teacher. She works in a kindergarten. 

Manvel himself has been providing excavation services for over five years. He receives different orders from neighboring villages and provides services with his own excavator. 

Unfortunately it is very old and needs to be renovated. Because of his family's daily costs, Manvel wasn't able to save money, so he has applied for this loan. He asks for this loan to be able to renovate his excavator and continue providing his service. 

Manvel has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly help Manvel as he will be able to renovate the excavator and will continue earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovating his old excavator so he  can continue to provide excavation services

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of two children, all of whom go to school which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

Saumu has operated a cereals shop business at the market for the past two years, selling to passers by and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land, Angela grows maize, beans, passion fruit, vegetables, potatoes, bananas, cabbages, and coffee. She also has chickens and cows. As a CKW Angela will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Angela will buy some more land and pay school fees for her children. Her biggest dream is to be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is 24 years old and has one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On her land, Racheal grows maize, beans, cassava, passion fruit, and coffee. She also has chickens, goats, pigs, bees, and cows. As a CKW, Rachael will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Racheal will invest in growing more coffee. Her biggest dream is to be a model farmer in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 34, married, and has eleven children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On his land Lawrence grows beans, coffee, and bananas. He also has some cows and chickens. As a CKW, Lawrence will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Lawrence will pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream in life is to be a model organic farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old and is married with two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Robert grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, peanuts, bananas, onions, peas and vegetables. He also has some cows, goats, sheep, pigs and chickens. As a CKW Robert will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Robert will invest in buying new agricultural tools and seeds for his farm. His biggest dream in life is to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

As a CKW Irene will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Irene will invest in new agricultural tools, livestock and seeds to increase her production. Her biggest dream in life is to be able to go back to school and study again.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

On his land Joseph grows maize, coffee, beans, cabbages, onions and bananas. He also has cows, sheep and chickens. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Joseph will buy some property. His biggest dream in life is to become a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is 40 years old and is married, with eight children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). 

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Laban grows maize, coffee, bananas, and onions. He also has cows and chickens. 

As a CKW Laban will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Laban will invest in hiring some laborers. 

His biggest dream in life is to be able to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is a master builder and is 49 years old. He is married with three teenaged children. One of them is a 19-year-old boy, who is studying in his second course of college. Another is a 17-year-old entrant and the little child goes to the tenth class of school. Shakir’s wife is a housewife. His family lives in the Baku region. 

It’s noted that Shakir is a master builder. He builds houses. Shakir learned this profession from his father. Today he needs a loan amount of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy construction materials that he needs in his work. Shakir is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations and the lenders for their help. In the future he wants to hire an assistant and a painter.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Tuleane Group

texts.en:
Bertha, who is in her early 50s, is married with six children: four sons and two daughters who are in school. For eight years now, Bertha has been managing her family life by running a retail shop selling dry food like sugar, maize flour, and baking flour, and other daily demanded home items like airtime. She starts working from 08:00am to 09:00pm every working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Bertha used her previous loans to buy some daily demanded items like flour, sugar, water, airtime, packed juice, etc. She has managed to pay back all of her previous loans successfully. She used her business profit to start building a house and covered household expenses. Bertha hopes that her business will improve more and will enable her life to become better. She will use this loan to buy more stock for her shop, especially seasonal items like rice, to resell. She dreams of finishing building and providing a better education for her kids.

Bertha will share this loan with her loan group Tuleane, which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop to resell, especially seasonal items like rice.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 27-year-old single lady who is currently employed in a certain company and is the sole breadwinner to five members of her family.


Khadra is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to help her brother in doing necessary maintenance to his house, and continue building it. Khadra is a very caring person who believes that she has to make sure that she can provide her family with everything they need.


She is planning to open her own hair beauty salon in the future, since she loves this domain, but she needs enough capital to start it.

loans.use: to help her brother in doing necessary maintenance to his house, and continue building it.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has three children ranging from 1 to 12 years old. He describes himself as an ambitious person. He operates a grinding mill where he grinds maize to produce maize flour for selling, and also sells other cereals. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 95 000 loan to add stock of maize and other cereals. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to support his family. He also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: to add stock of maize and other cereals.

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila is 27 years-old.  She is married and has no children  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Urmila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a hard-working and enterprising woman.She is a single woman of one child, who is still underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Salama prepares dumplings using sugar,cooking oil,and wheat flour and sells to neighbours and passers by.She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour,sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour,sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, and charcoal for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This is Mwanamisi. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to purchase ingredients for her food preparing business. She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional stock of food ingredients for her business. 

Mwanamisi's profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of  food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Femmes Vertueuses 1 Group

texts.en:
Dina is one of the members of the group Femmes Vertueuses. She is the leader of a group consisting of three other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Dina owns a used clothing shop and will use her loan to purchase large packs of clothing which include dress pants and shirts for her customers. 

Dina has been with HOPE Congo for five loan cycles and faces challenges relating to the quality of merchandise that she is able to find when buying in bulk. Dina has found that giving a warm greeting to her customers provides her with an advantage over her competitors. Her goal is to open a second store location where she can expand and sell even more in the future. Ultimately Dina hopes to be able to cover the school fees for all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of fish for her market stand.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 28 years old and married with two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools.

On his land, Bosco grows coffee. He also has some cows. As a CKW, Bosco will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them improve their crop yields and increase their income. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Bosco will pay for his children's school fees as well as some medical bills. His biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 20-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two cows that she uses for selling milk to the people of her community. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Nadia has become famous for providing high quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. To meet the increasing demands of her customers she has applied for a loan of 15,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Nadia is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en: Fazeelat, age 43, is a married woman and the mother of three children. Fazeelat has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales have increased as well as her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 8th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to use for milk sales.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 38-year-old married woman who has been doing business selling milk for the past 10 years. She has 2 cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with a beautiful life. In order to increase her sales, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow to use for milk sales.

On his land, Patrick grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, potatoes, bananas and pumpkins. He also has some cows, goats, pigs and turkeys. 

As a CKW, Patrick will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Uru

texts.en:
Uru lives in the village of Dashtapa, Marneuli District. She is 38 years old, married and mother of three children. Uru is running the agricultural business for the family. They own twenty-five turkeys and plan to sell them for the New Year for a good price. Besides turkeys, Uru grows alfalfa (Lucerne) on the family-owned plot of land and sells the harvest locally, as it is used for cattle feeding. 
 
She requested credit to purchase sheep and start the farm. She will start selling lambs after several months in a nearby town's open market as well. The income of the family will increase. In the future, Uru plans to reinvest part of the income in the sheep-breeding business for its further development. The other part of the increased income will be used to improve the daily living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start breeding sheep.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is a married man aged 42 years with seven children, five of whom are attending different schools. He lives with his family and mother who is very old and two of his nephews who lost their parents. He is in the produce business where he purchases coffee, beans, and maize, and he also carries out agriculture which he considers as his side business. He started his business in 1999.

He works seven days in a week and 13 hours per day and started his business because a friend advised him to carry out such business after he explained to him the good profits one can make out of such a business. He acquired this loan to boost the coffee produce business and to also get school fees for his children. His clients are traders from nearby villages.

His future hopes are to be the leading supplier of coffee in his home area and to educate his children. The main challenge he faces is too much drought, which affects the quality of coffee. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man who encourages lenders to increase on the grace period they give to their clients.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Femmes Vertueuses 2 Group

texts.en: Hortense is one of the members of the group Femmes Vertueuses 2 and is the leader of a group consisting of three other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Hortense is not married and this is her fifth loan cycle with HOPE Congo. Hortense sells salted fish and other products to her customers and will use the loan to purchase fish in bulk as well as fabric which her clients can buy to make dresses. Like many merchants, she and her business were hit hard by the economic crisis, but she has overcome those difficulties by diversifying some of her activities. In the future, Hortense has plans to become a wholesaler of fish instead of a vendor. She hopes to one day purchase a parcel of land to build a home for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk for her fish stand.

loans.name: Niazi

texts.en:
Niazi lives in the village of Dashtapa, Marneuli District. He is 35 years old, married and the father of three children. Niazi lives with his retired parents. He is running the agricultural business for the family. He grows maize on the family-owned plot of land and tomatoes in the greenhouse. He sells his harvest among vegetable retailers and earns seasonal income. 

He requested credit to purchase sheep and start the farm. He will start selling lambs after several months in a nearby town's open market. The income of the family will increase. In the future, Niazi plans to reinvest part of the income in the sheep-breeding business for its further development. The other part of the increased income will be used to improve the daily living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start up a sheep farm.

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land, John grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, sweet potatoes, peanuts and bananas. He also has cows, goats, pigs and chickens. As a CKW, John will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, John will invest in his farm by buying feed for his livestock. His biggest dream in life is to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Beauty Group

texts.en:
Sanaa is the featured borrower of Beauty Group, she and the other group members want to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Sanaa is a 45-year-old divorced mother of three children. She works hard to provide them with a very good living, through working hard on developing her business in a well managed way.

She has been working in the beauty business since 2008 from her house. She specializes in facial beauty and nails.

Sanaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy special facial cleaning products and beauty creams that will be highly requested before the winter season and especially during this month.

Almost all of her customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends, who support her a lot to expand her business and develop her family's living standards.

She hopes that in the future, she'll be financially capable of opening her separate beauty therapy salon outside her house and accept new customers. 
She is the lady sitting in the middle with blonde hair. As for the other group members, Mariam is the lady sitting at the far right side of the picture, and Chirine is the first lady from the left with a veil covering her hair.

loans.use: to purchase special facial cleaning products and beauty creams that will be highly requested before the winter season and especially during this month.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their loan funding system. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She is requesting a loan of ksh 20,000 to purchase twenty pieces of women's wrap clothes (khangas) to sell. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase twenty pieces of women's wrap clothes (khangas) to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 37 years old and is married with five children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Michael grows maize, coffee and onions. He also has goats, pigs and chickens. As a CKW Michael will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Michael will invest in his farm by buying new agricultural tools and seeds. His biggest dream in life is to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it, she will improve her business.
 
The previous loan enabled her to to save money in her charcoal selling business. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale to provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Nargiss

texts.en:
Nargiss is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been in business with a beauty parlor for 10 years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her providing the best services she has become very famous on her street. 
In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Nargiss is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her second loan of 30,000 PKR. It will help her to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time which ultimately helps in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Rosta

texts.en:
Rosta is 30 years old and married with three children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools.

On her land, Rosta grows maize, beans, cassava, passion fruit, vegetables, peanuts, bananas, avocados, soy, and coffee. She also has cows, goats, rabbits, turkeys, and chickens. 

As a CKW, Rosta will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale to provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale to provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Samuel

On his land, Samuel grows beans, coffee, and rice. He also has some goats and chickens. As a CKW Samuel will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is from Ijevan town. He lives there with his wife and 22-year-old son. For many years, Vachagan has been involved in timber retail business. He takes timber to Yerevan and sells it there. Before applying for this loan, Vachagan was organizing the transportation with a rented truck. Now he would like to ask for this loan to be able to purchase a truck and use it for the transportation of timer. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for this hard working man in being able to decrease costs of transportation and gather more money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to be able to transport timber and sell it.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land, Caro grows maize, beans, cassava, vegetables, bananas, onions, peas and coffee. She also has cows, goats and chickens. Caro has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Caro will pay school fees for her children. Her biggest dream is to be a successful coffee farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale to  provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 years old and is married with four children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land, Catherine grows maize, beans, peanuts, cassava, bananas and coffee. She also has goats and cows. As a CKW, Catherine will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Catherine will pay school fees for her children. Her biggest dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale to provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Souheila

texts.en:
Souheila is a 49-year-old single lady who is responsible for the living of two other members of her family.
Souheila is employed in a roaster's shop where they sell special nuts, sweets and coffee and has for three years.
This is her only source for living and she works hard to stay capable of getting her manager's and the customer's satisfaction to make sure that she'll maintain her current position.
Souheila is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to pay for her urgent personal medication expenses.
She is very anxious about this loan sine she is the sole breadwinner to two other members of her family and she has to be in very good health to keep providing them with their necessary needs.
She is dreaming of opening her own business that has to do with selling women's accessories and needs in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her urgent personal medical expenses

loans.name: Rusiano

texts.en:
Rusiano is a married man, age 47 years with three children, two attending school. He lives in a rural setting with his family and other two children who are orphans; he caters for their school fees. He is an agriculturalist and rears cattle and grows maize and banana in a plantation. Rusiano is a businessman who deals in a retail shop, which he considers as his side business. He started his business in 1990.

He works 7 days a week and 10 hours per day, and started his business to get money for school fees. He has acquired this loan to buy fertilizers for his agricultural products. His clients are traders from the city and those from the villages around his home.

His future hope is to be the leading supplier of agricultural products in the district. The challenge he faces is the unpredictable weather, like too much drought that ends up making every crop dry. 

He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man who encourages lenders to reduce the interest rates to enable low income earners to access loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is 29 years old. She is Married and has two children, ages 10 and 9. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business. In the future, Sushila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
 
Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold at the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Durga Devi

texts.en:
Durga Devi is 25 years old. She is married and has one child, aged nine. In 2009, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. Durga Devi has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and is using her most recent loan to buy materials for her business. In the future, Durga Devi plans to uplift her family's economic condition.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. The streets are lined with tailor stalls where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth materials or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Aqsa

texts.en:
Aqsa is a married woman and the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing a business manufacturing carpet for the past ten years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and has become famous in providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. 
Aqsa is also sewing as her part time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family's needs and requirements effectively.  It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; currently she has applied for a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.  She wishes to use part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 28 years old and is married with two children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, as well as a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Lydia will pay school fees for her children and save some money for future emergencies. Her biggest dream is to be a successful coffee farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: İbrahim

texts.en:
İbrahim is married. He is 26 years old and lives with his wife in the Baku region. His wife is pregnant and soon his child will be born. Ibrahim wants to provide a better future for his child, therefore he wants to increase his monthly income. Ibrahim rents a salon and for three years he has been in the barber business. 
Today he needs a loan amount of 1500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to change the doors and windows of his salon. He hopes that the view of the salon will be better and through this he will increase the number of clients. Ibrahim is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the aid. In the future he wants to give a good education to his child.

loans.use: to change the doors and windows of his salon

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 38 years-old. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 16. Many years ago, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, two loans from Patan BPW; and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. 

In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell materials and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as traditional women's (kurta surwal) and men's (daura surwal) clothing. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 40 years old. She is married and has three children aged 18, 14 and 13.  Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.
