loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila is 27 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 7.  In 2008, she established her tea shop business.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Urmila plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Sevan

texts.en:
Sevan is a 29-year-old married Lebanese woman. She is a wonderful wife cooperating with her husband financially to meet their life needs. Sevan works at producing jewelry globes which are used in amazing designs of bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc. 
And today, Sevan is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l since she is requiring additional tools to help with her business growth and expansion. This will be her first Kiva loan and she is quite certain it will impact her positively and also positively impact her business which will return to her through higher income.

loans.use: to possess additional tools to help with her business growth and expansion

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo appreciates lenders for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 KES to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as a honest person. He operates a retail store, in which he sells pans, plastic containers, cooking stoves, etc. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase stock of scrap metal for making cooking stoves and cooking pans. He will use the anticipated profits to support his family. He also farms to earn extra income.

loans.use: to increase stock of scrap metal for making cooking stoves and cooking pans

loans.name: Bertamina

texts.es: Bertamina, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, y vive junto a un hijo en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Doña Bertamina, lleva 10 años de tener su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como manteca, azúcar, refrescos, productos de aseo, carnes etc. ha obtenido varios prestamos con los que ha mantenido estable su negocio, actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo que es por 8,000 lempiras para seguir manteniendo surtida la pulpería y ofrecer variedad de productos. comprara granos básicos, refrescos, azúcar, manteca, productos de aseo, productos plásticos y de belleza. una de sus meta es remodelar su casa y el negocio.
texts.en: Bertamina is a single mother, has three children, and lives with her son in a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara suburb.  Bertamina has had her own business for 10 years, a store where she sells food products such as lard, sugar, soft drinks, toiletries, meats, etc.  She has gotten several loans with which she has maintained her store stocked and offers a variety of products.  She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, lard, toiletries, plastic products, and beauty products.  One of her goals is to remodel her home and business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en:
Matiya is a married man, age 38 years with six children, four of whom attend schools. He lives in rural setting with his family, and looks after his parents because they are very old and need someone's support to earn a living. He deals in a retail shop business, carries out agriculture where he grows tomatoes, beans and maize on a large scale, and does produce business as his side business.

He started his business in 2005. He works seven days a week and 12 hours per day. He started his business to develop and earn a living. He has acquired this loan to purchase more stocks for his retail shop. His retail shop clients are local residents from his village and his produce and agricultural businesses traders are from the city.

His hopes are to be the leading supplier of tomatoes, maize, and beans in his village, and to enlarge his retail shop up to the level of a wholesale. The challenges he faces are price fluctuations and many customers taking long to settle their debts. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man who encourages lenders to continue helping business people and train their clients about loans and businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for his retail shop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man aged 42 years with three children, two of whom are attending school.
He is a businessman running a boutique in his trading center which is attended to by his wife.
Alongside the above mentioned business he also has two taxis and a produce store which also earns him an income at the end of the month.

He works 7 days a week and 12 hours per day and he started these businesses to improve his income and his family's standard of living.

He acquired this loan to purchase more clothes for his boutique and stock some produce for the festive season. His future hope is to expand his boutique business and to supply agricultural produce in large quantities.

The challenge he faces is too much drought and price fluctuation. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man and encourages lenders to always reduce the interest rates so that low income earners can also borrow money.

loans.use: To buy clothes for his boutique

loans.name: Izabella

texts.en: Izabella is an experienced farmer from Hovtashen village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband (in the photo) and son. Her husband is employed in the private sector and her son works in the government sector. Their salaries, however, are not enough to fully cover their needs. To assist her family members in earning a living, Izabella is engaged in agribusiness; she breeds cattle and cultivates alfalfa, peaches and apricots, and sells the agricultural products in the local market. Izabella's agribusiness currently needs some investments in order for it to function in a sustainable and productive way. She needs a loan of USD 2,100 to renovate the barn and the greenhouse and pay for harvesting services. Izabella and her family members highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the barn and the greenhouse and pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Saphira

texts.en: Saphira is 34 years old and is married with six children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and also earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Saphira grows maize, beans, vegetables, bananas, onions, passion fruit and coffee. She also has cows, rabbits, goats and chickens. As a CKW Saphira will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Saphira will invest in buying new agricultural tools. Her biggest dream is to be a model farmer in her community and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 39 years old and is married with two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and also earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land David grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, bananas and cabbages. He also has cows, goats and chickens. As a CKW David will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, David will invest in buying new agricultural tools for his farm. His biggest dream in life is to go back and finish his studies.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 47 years old and is married with five children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Moses grows maize, beans, coffee and bananas. He also has some chickens. As a CKW Moses will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Moses will invest in growing more coffee and buy some cows. His biggest dream in life is to build a nice home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Dison

texts.en:
Dison is 35 years old and is married with 10 children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Dison grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava and passion fruit. He also has a cow and some chickens. 

As a CKW, Dison will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Dison will invest in new agricultural tools. His biggest dream in life is to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 28 years old and is married with no children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Stephen grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, peanuts and bananas. He also has cows, chickens and goats. As a CKW Stephen will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Stephen will invest in his farm. His biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale to provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 27 years old and is married with three children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land James grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, onions and bananas. He also has cows, goats and chickens. As a CKW, James will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, James will buy more land to farm on as he currently only has three acres. His biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer and free people in his community from poverty by helping them to adopt good agricultural practices.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 30 years old and is married with four children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On his land Peter grows maize, coffee, beans and bananas. He also has cows and chickens. As a CKW, Peter will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Peter will invest in his farm by increasing his coffee production. His biggest dream in life is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Indira is 29 years old . She is married and has one child, aged 10. In 2008, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy small chicks for her business. In the future, Indira plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens for her business

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 13 and 8.  In 2008, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week, and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business.  In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea, a couple of which can be purchased for a few cents.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked, while increasing their profit margins, by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores patos, gallinas, cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio , es una mujer emprendedora ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos paras su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 47 years old and lives in the District of Oyotun. Her town is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This town is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Carmen Rosa raises small animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs in an area behind her home. She is an enterprising woman who is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. The loan will be used to buy balanced feed, but part of the money will also be used to buy pigs so that she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Ovsanna

texts.en:
Ovsanna is from Vanadzor town. She lives with her two sons and husband. For over five years, Ovsanna has been involved in a bakery business. She bakes different types of cookies and sells them in the local stores. From time to time, she also receives orders from individuals and works hard to provide high quality service to her clients.

Now, Ovsanna needs financial support for being able to purchase materials for the bakery and renovate the car by which Ovsanna's husband transports the cookies to the store. This is the reason why Ovsanna has applied for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for this family and Ovsanna hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the bakery business and renovate the car for transporting products to stores

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is an experienced farmer from Goravan village of the Ararat region. She lives with her son. Both of them are employed in the private sector and work hard to earn a living for the family. Unfortunately, their salaries alone are not enough to fully cover their needs. Julieta is also engaged in agribusiness. She is involved in aviculture, and in the cultivation of wheat, peaches, plums, figs, apples, and walnuts. Her son helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of income for them. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Julieta needs a loan of $3,000 to renovate the barn, to purchase two calves, to buy wheat seeds, and to pay for the harvesting services. She and her son highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for the support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the barn, to purchase two calves, to buy wheat seeds, and to pay for the harvesting services

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is a young farmer from the city of Goris in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, one-year-old daughter, and mother-in-law.  Gayane's husband is employed in the private sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. With the help of her mother-in-law, Gayane is engaged in cattle breeding. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an essential source of the family's income. As life is getting more expensive on a day-to-day basis, it becomes harder to make ends meet. This is why Gayane wants to expand her agribusiness in order to be able to more effectively meet the increasing needs of her family. A loan of 1,500 USD will be a great support to this young, hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to purchase ten pigs. As this is Gayane’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Gayane and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan amount in order to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase ten pigs

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is a farmer from Tatev village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two school-age sons – 10 and 8 years old. With the help of her husband Armine is extensively engaged in agribusiness which is the main source of the family's income. They are involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding a livestock of sheep, and in beekeeping. Armine's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market. Armine and her husband work hard to be able to cover the increasing needs of the family. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Armine wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to meet the daily costs of the family more effectively. She needs a loan of USD 2000 to purchase two cows. As this is Armine’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. She and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en: Volodya is a young farmer from Verishen village of Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, two-year-old daughter, brother, and parents. Volodya's mother works as a baker in the private sector. To take care of his big family's needs, Volodya is extensively engaged in agribusiness. He is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding a livestock of piglets, and in cultivation of grass. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of his family's income. Volodya's brother and father assist him in his daily activities related to farming. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way and to develop it further Volodya needs a loan of USD 2500 to purchase three cows. He and his large family highly rely on the lender's support and will be grateful to them for their goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Svetik

texts.en: Svetik is from Tegh village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. She works at the village local school as a teacher. Her salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. With the help of her family members Svetik is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of her family's income. For more than 17 years, Svetik has been involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding a livestock of sheep, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of wheat and grass. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Svetik wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of USD 3000 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 28 sheep. Svetik and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to purchase 28 sheep

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is an experienced farmer from Goris city of the Syuniq region.  She lives with her husband. The latter works in the private sector. His salary, unfortunately, is not enough to meet the needs of his family. With the help of her husband, Ruzanna is extensively engaged in agribusiness to be able to make the ends meet. It has been more than seven years since she became involved in breeding livestock (cows and piglets). They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family.

 As life is getting more expensive, Ruzanna wants to expand her agribusiness in order to cover the needs of the family more effectively. A loan of USD $1,500 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to purchase two cows. Ruzanna and her husband rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Artavazd

texts.en:
Artavazd is a young farmer from Goris city of the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife and 1-year-old son. Artavazd works as a driver in the government sector. His salary, however, is so low that he cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To be able to make ends meet, Artavazd is extensively engaged in agribusiness; he breeds cattle and sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of family's income. 

As the needs of the family are increasing with time, Artavazd wants to expand his agribusiness a little bit to be able to more effectively meet the family's expenses. A loan of USD $2,500 will assist him greatly, enabling him to purchase two cows and a steer. Artavazd and his family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and a steer.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is an experienced farmer from Goris city of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter-in-law.  Her husband renovates cars, and her son works in the private sector. They are the main breadwinners of the family working really hard struggling for living. To assist her family members in earning a living Karine is engaged in cattle breeding and in breeding a livestock of piglets. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of her family's income. To sustain her agribusiness and develop it further Karine needs a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a cow and a pig. As this is Karine’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. She and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a pig

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 30 years old and is married with two children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and through livestock. She earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land Rhoda grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas. She also has cows and chickens. 

As a CKW, Rhoda will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Rhoda will invest in new agricultural tools, livestock and seeds to increase her production. Her biggest dream in life is to be an expert in agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 45 years old and is married with seven children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land, Fredrick grows maize, coffee, beans, cabbages, onions and bananas. He also has cows and chickens. As a CKW, Fredrick will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Fredrick will pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream in life is to become a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is 31 years old and is married with four children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land, Johnson grows maize, coffee, and bananas. He also has a cow and some chickens. As a CKW, Johnson will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Johnson will buy another cow for his farm and open up a little shop. His biggest dream in life is to be able to send all of his four children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 28 years old and is married with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Sylvia grows maize, beans, coffee, and bananas. She also has cows and chickens. As a CKW Sylvia will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Sylvia will invest in new agricultural tools and seeds to increase her production. Her biggest dream in life is to be able to go back to school.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 26 years old and has one child with her partner. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Catherine grows maize, beans and coffee. She also has cows, goats and chickens. As a CKW Catherine will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Catherine will invest in growing more coffee. Her biggest dream in life is to be an expert in agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is 37 years old and is married with six children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Steven grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, passionfruit, peanuts, eggplants, mangoes and bananas. He also has a cow and some chickens. As a CKW, Steven will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Steven will invest in growing his coffee plantation further. His biggest dream in life is to be able to provide his children with a good education and see them get good jobs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Gimono

texts.en:
Gimono is 25 years old and is married with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land Gimono grows maize, beans, wheat, bananas, onions, cabbages, pumpkins and coffee. She also has cows, goats, sheep, pigs, rabbits, turkeys and chickens. 

As a CKW, Gimono will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Gimono will start a small business. Her biggest dream is to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester de 64 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus pequeños nietos de 10 y 11 años de edad.  Es una mujer increíble quien no se cansa de trabajar. Ester, se dedica a la venta de artesanías de barro, curtido, especies, etc. Desea invertir en su negocio ya que quiere dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la comprar mayor variedad de artesanías de barro, más curtidos, especies, etc. ya que sus productos son muy demandados y tiene plena confianza que de esta forma logrará incrementar sus ventas e ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ester is 64 years old and lives in her own home with her young grandchildren (ages 10 and 11). She is an incredible woman who does not get tired of working. Ester sells clay handicrafts, cabbage salad, spices, and other items. She wants to invest in her business so that she can provide her grandchildren better living conditions.

For this reason, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of a wider variety of clay handicrafts, as well as more cabbage salad, spices, and other items. Her products are in very high demand, so she is fully confident that her sales and earnings will increase. As a result, her quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clay handicrafts, as well as cabbage salad and spices to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes, es soltera sola lucha para salir adelante, sus hijos aunque ya son independientes viven con ella junto a sus nueras, se dedica a hacer tortillas en su casa de habitación, también vende cuajadas y refrescos. El objetivo principal de doña Mercedes es cambiar una pared de cuarto por concreto ya que al pasar el tiempo esta se puede derribar, porque es de plycem un material liviano que se deteriora con el tiempo, pero ella no cuenta con efectivo para cumplir con esta mejora por lo que acude a este préstamo para poder realizarlo, los materiales a comprar son: cemento, arena, bloques, hierro, de esta manera desea ir  paulatinamente reparando su casita, para vivir tranquila junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is single and strives to move forward alone. Even though her children are independent, they live with their in-laws.

Mercedes makes tortillas at home. She also sells curds and soft drinks. Doña Mercedes' main goal is to replace a wall in one of her rooms with concrete since it has worn down over time. The existing wall is made of fiberboard, a lightweight material that deteriorates over time.

Mercedes does not have the funds to complete this improvement, so she has requested a loan in order to accomplish this goal. The materials she will purchase include cement, sand, blocks, and iron. She wants to gradually repair her small house so that she and her family can live peacefully.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, blocks, and iron.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman. She has four children; two of whom attend school, and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mesaidi operates a cashew nut selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a married woman with seven children; four are in school and the rest are adults. She lives in a cement house with neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates a cashew nut selling business and she has been in this business for 10 years.

She'll use the loan to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

Her hope is that her business does well, so that she can venture into a large-scale cashew nut selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She was able to purchase a new motor bike using the loan. She stills sells firewood and charcoal. She is requesting a loan of KSH 20,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush is from Odzun village of the Lori region. She lives with her husband and two little sons (7 and 5 years old, and shown in the photo). 

Haykanush works at the village local school as a teacher. Unfortunately, the teacher salary is so low that she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. With the help of her husband, it has already been more than five years since Haykanush became engaged in aviculture. They have a farm of 2,000 hens. Haykanush and her husband sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of their income. 

In order to continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way and to develop it further, Haykanush needs to make some investments. A loan of USD $3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 1,200 hens for the farm. Haykanush and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 1,200 hens for the farm

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe is a young farmer from Aravus village of Syuniq region. He lives with his elderly pensioner grandparents. To take care of his family Vahe is extensively engaged in agribusiness; he is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in breeding a livestock of sheep. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is his only source of income. Vahe works very hard and is the one taking care of his elderly grandparents. As their needs are increasing over time Vahe wants to expand his agribusiness. A loan of USD 3000 will be a great support to this young hard-working farmer enabling him to purchase three cows. As this is Vahe’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Vahe and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their help.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco agradece a los inversionistas del préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, él continua vendiendo en la ciudad del Cusco y sigue teniendo su salón de belleza donde hace diferentes tipos de cortes y le va muy bien, él requiere el préstamo para invertir en el salón de belleza y desea comprar más materiales de trabajo como  tintes, champús, acondicionadores entre otros.

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.(Francisco tiene otra opcion sexual).
texts.en:
Francisco is grateful to the lenders and is happy about the support.  He still lives in the city of Cusco and still has a beauty salon where he provides different types of cuts.  Things are going very well for him and he needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as tints, shampoos, conditioners, and other things. 

Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial zone, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it hosts one of the seven wonders of the world, “Machupicchu.”  (Francisco is transgender.)

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity.

Mwanasiti has operated a cosmetic business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women.

With the loan of 15,000 KES she wants to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, chemicals, and air conditioners for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, chemicals, and air conditioners for resale

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en: Mwanamina is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom go to school.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.  Mwanamina prepares sweet dumplings and sells them to neighbors and passersby.  She cites seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges.  With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.  She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en: Mesalimu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en: Bintiomari is a married woman who has been blessed with four school-going children.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  Bintiomari operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.  She is requesting for a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.  She joined Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Bintifaki

texts.en: Bintifaki is a divorced mother of two children who are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Bintifaki has operated a cashew nut selling business at the market for the past twenty years, selling to passersby and neighbors.  She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.  With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.  She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en: Biasha is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. Biasha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.  Biasha operates a cashew nut selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: This is Mwanamisi.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to purchase more household consumables for her business.  She still operates the retail shop and she now wants to make juice and sell it in her shop.  She would like to apply for a loan of KES 40,000, to buy juice flavors and fruits for her business.  Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy juice flavors and fruits for her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a business woman who is very hardworking.  She is a married woman with two children, both of whom go to school.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Mwanasiti has operated a firewood selling business for the past 3 years.  Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby.  With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en: Mwanahamisi is a married mother of two children, both whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Mwanahamisi has operated a groundnut (peanut) selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to passersby and neighbors.  She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.  With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of groundnuts for resale.  She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of groundnuts (peanuts) for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  Beside the dumpling selling business, she prepares fresh juice and sells it to passersby and her neighbors.  She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fruits such as oranges and mangoes and juice flavors for her business.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits such as oranges and mangoes and juice flavors for her business

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en: Meswalehe appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more food ingredients like maize flour, sugar, onions, and tomatoes for her business.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients like maize flour, sugar, onions, and tomatoes for her business

loans.name: Zaliana

texts.en:
Zaliana is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Zaliana operates a car and bicycle spare parts selling business. She cites price fluctuation as her major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase spare parts such as car and bicycle tyres, engine parts, and other car body parts for her business. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as car and bicycle tyres, engine parts, and other car body parts for her business

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is divorced, with three school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Kibibi is requesting KES 20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is still single, with no children.   He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food .

Ndoro operates a cereal-selling business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to buy sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.  He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Wakili

texts.en:
Wakili is hard-working and enterprising, someone who appreciates Kiva for her previous loan, which enabled her to save money and open a cafe. 

Beside the clothes-selling business, she makes constables like rice, tea, beans, and chapati( flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality  as her major challenge.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for her business

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES.40,000 to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Varazdat

texts.en: Varazdat is a farmer from the Bashgyugh village of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, daughter, and two sons. His sons have migrated to Russia as labor migrants; they work there and send money to the family to take care of their needs. Varazdat works as a forester. His salary, however, is so low that he cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To be able to meet the ends Varazdat is engaged in cattle breeding, in sheep breading, and in the cultivation of wheat and grass. Varazdat sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of family’s income. His family members assist him greatly in his daily activities related to farming. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Varazdat needs to make some investments. He needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase an agricultural mower and to make previous credit repayments. The agricultural machinery will help Varazdat organize his agribusiness in a more effective way. Varazdat and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase an agricultural mower and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en: Yurik is an experienced farmer from the village of Haykadzor in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, two daughters (18 and 15 years old), and his elderly pensioner mother. To take care of his family Yurik works as a clerk in the government sector. His salary, however, is so low, that he cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. With the help of his family members Yurik is also engaged in agribusiness. He is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding pigs, and in the cultivation of wheat. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of the family’s income. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Yurik needs a loan of 2,000 USD tto purchase wheat seeds, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, to renovate agricultural machinery, and to make previous credit repayments. Yurik and his family members highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for the support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, to renovate agricultural machinery, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is a private entrepreneur from the city of Gyumri in the region of Shirak. She lives with her husband. For the past five years, Anahit has run a small local grocery store. This small business is the main source of the family's income. Anahit's husband assists her greatly in organizational issues related to entrepreneurship. The assortment of goods that she sells in her store is not that diverse and needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to function in a productive way and to be compatible. Anahit want to make some investments in her small business to sustain it. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and will enable her to purchase grocery products and juices for resale in her small store. Anahit and her husband highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to develop their small business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products and juices to resell in her small store

loans.name: Gulu

texts.en:
Gulu is a farmer, and she is single. Her mother has been sick for many years, and Gulu has taken care of her mother so far. As well, Gulu didn’t leave her father alone, so she hasn’t married. 

Over this time, her father has died but she still lives with her mother in Fuzuli region, which is near a war zone. Her family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli City. 

It’s noted that she is a farmer, and Gulu has few cows. She makes dairy products and sells them. She also sells cows to a butcher. 

Today she needs a loan of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). She will use this loan to buy a few cows to increase her monthly income and business. She is thankful to the Komak company, the Kiva organization, and lenders for their help. 

In the future, she wants to build a new and big stall for cows.

loans.use: to buy a few cows to increase her monthly income and business

loans.name: Feyzi

texts.en: Feyzi has been a taxi driver for three years. He is 29 years old. Feyzi has been married for two years and has a child. His wife is a housewife who takes care of her baby. Feyzi’s family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their motherland Fuzuli city. Now they live Mahmudlu village of Fuzuli region near to the war zone. Today Feyzi has applied for a loan in amount of 600 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the car’s salon. He is thankful to Komak company, the Kiva organization, and lenders for help. In the future he wants to buy a new wheel and to set conditioner for his car.

loans.use: to repair his car’s salon.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is a business woman who is very hardworking.  She is married with three children, all of whom go to school.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Mwanatumu has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 2 years.  Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.  With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married with no children.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.  For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and garments for both men and women.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.  With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a married woman with one child who is still underage.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.  Mwanasiti operates a food making business, making things like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors.  With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.  She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Barika

texts.en: Barika appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She still operates a salon business.  She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Donita

texts.en: This is Donita.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to purchase more cereal for her business.  Beside the cereal business, she sells clothes.  She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy bales of clothes for her business.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren is a married woman with four children, all of whom go to school.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  Caren has operated a beauty salon business for the past ten years.  Her potential customers are women.  She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future.  With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.  She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en: Esha is a married mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one who is an adult.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.  She make soft drinks and ice cubes using fruits and juice flavors and sells it to her neighbors and passersby.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.  With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi is a married woman and has four children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  She has operated a fish selling business for the last five years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en: Dzame is married and has five children.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.  For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and garments for both men and women.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.  With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Nakondo

texts.en: Nakondo is married and has three children, one of whom is in school and two are adults.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.  For the past four years, she has operated a tobacco business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of high competition from other sellers.  With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase more tobacco for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco for her business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married, with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuations as her major challenge.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en: Mesaidi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KSH 50,000 to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is married woman with three children: one of whom attends school and two adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eloglan

texts.en:
Eloglan is 42 years old, married and has three children: a 13-year old son who goes to school, an 11-year old daughter who is also in school and a son who is 3 years old. His family has been IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) from Füzuli city for 20 years and now they live in Mahmudlu village of Füzuli region. 

Eloglan has cows. He sells their milk and dairy products (yogurt, cheese and etc). Today Eloglan needs 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat), for this reason he applied to Komak company for a loan. Eloglan plans to use that to supply for winter and wants buy enough hay for cows, vaccinations for them, etc. 

It should be noted that it’s his third loan. Previously he took a loan from Kiva organization twice and those loans to promote the development of his business. Eloglan thankful for this loan to Komak company, Kiva organization and lenders. In the future to increase his business Eloglan wants to buy more cows.

loans.use: to supply his cows for winter
